intro: Rhynchosia chimanimaniensis, commonly known as the Chimanimani legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are pinnate, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. Rhynchosia chimanimaniensis is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
